newsitem.title: USA: Duracell top execs announce intention to leave.
newsitem.headline: Duracell top execs announce intention to leave.

text.p: The Gillette Co, which hopes to complete its aquisition of Duracell International Inc before year's end announced Thursday that two top Duracell executives would be leaving.

The announcement of the departure of Duracell Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Charles Perrin, 51, and Duracell President Charles Kiernan, 51, came after a regularly scheduled Gillette board meeting.
The two men announced their intention to resign after a short transition period once the merger is approved by stockholders of both companies on Dec. 30.

The board also announced that Gillette Executive Vice President Edward DeGraan, 53, would head a new unit called Duracell North Atlantic Group, which would encompass operations in North America and Western Europe.

Gillette's board also elected Steven Staves, 44, currently a president of Duracell's International Development Markets, a corporate vice president of Gillette, a Boston-based company. Duracell is headquartered in Bethel, Conn.
The company also announced it regular dividend of 18 cents per share payable March 5 to shareholders of Feb. 3 ((--Boston bureau, 617-367-4106))
